solution.text:
Inner radius of pipe, \(r_1=_{j}_\,cm\)
Outer radius of pipe, \(r_2=_{k}_\,cm\)
Length of pipe, \(h=_{l}_\, cm\)
Density of material of the pipe, \(\rho=_{m}_\,\frac{g}{cm^3}\)
Volume of the pipe, \(V=\pi (r_2^2-r_1^2)h\)
\(=\pi (_{k}_^2-_{j}_^2) \times _{l}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*(k**2-j**2)*l),3)}}_\,cm^3\)
Mass of the pipe\(=\)Volume \(\times\) Density
\(=V \times \rho\)
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*(k**2-j**2)*l),3)}}_ \times _{m}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((m*pi_val*(k**2-j**2)*l),3)}}_\, gms\)
\(=_{{trunc(((m/Decimal(1000))*pi_val*(k**2-j**2)*l),3)}}_\,kgs\)

content.text: Find the mass of a pipe with inner radius \(_{j}_\)cm, outer radius \(_{k}_\)cm and length \(_{l}_\)cm. Assume density of the material to be \(_{m}_\)g/cu.cm.
